body: Since no more extra machines fo multi-gpu training, I am training coco on a single gpu now. It may finished after 1 or 2 days, and I will @ you as soon as finished training.
@lufficc Yeah, training COCO on only one GPU is really time-consuming. Looking forward to hearing your good news!

```
 Average Precision  (AP) @[ IoU=0.50:0.95 | area=   all | maxDets=100 ] = 0.218
 Average Precision  (AP) @[ IoU=0.50      | area=   all | maxDets=100 ] = 0.386
 Average Precision  (AP) @[ IoU=0.75      | area=   all | maxDets=100 ] = 0.220
 Average Precision  (AP) @[ IoU=0.50:0.95 | area= small | maxDets=100 ] = 0.063
 Average Precision  (AP) @[ IoU=0.50:0.95 | area=medium | maxDets=100 ] = 0.235
 Average Precision  (AP) @[ IoU=0.50:0.95 | area= large | maxDets=100 ] = 0.357
 Average Recall     (AR) @[ IoU=0.50:0.95 | area=   all | maxDets=  1 ] = 0.222
 Average Recall     (AR) @[ IoU=0.50:0.95 | area=   all | maxDets= 10 ] = 0.328
 Average Recall     (AR) @[ IoU=0.50:0.95 | area=   all | maxDets=100 ] = 0.359
 Average Recall     (AR) @[ IoU=0.50:0.95 | area= small | maxDets=100 ] = 0.144
 Average Recall     (AR) @[ IoU=0.50:0.95 | area=medium | maxDets=100 ] = 0.397
 Average Recall     (AR) @[ IoU=0.50:0.95 | area= large | maxDets=100 ] = 0.520
```
Seems the paper doesn't report the minival.
@lufficc Yes, the original SSD paper conducts the evaluation on the `test-dev2015`.

@lufficc , In ssd_trainval35k.yaml
```
MODEL:
  NUM_CLASSES: 81
  PRIORS:
    FEATURE_MAPS: [38, 19, 10, 5, 3, 1]
    STRIDES: [8, 16, 32, 64, 100, 300]
    MIN_SIZES: [21, 45, 99, 153, 207, 261]
    MAX_SIZES: [45, 99, 153, 207, 261, 315]
    ASPECT_RATIOS: [[2], [2, 3], [2, 3], [2, 3], [2], [2]]
    BOXES_PER_LOCATION: [4, 6, 6, 6, 4, 4]
INPUT:
  IMAGE_SIZE: 300
DATASETS:
  TRAIN: ("coco_2014_valminusminival",)
  TEST: ("coco_2014_minival", )
SOLVER:
  MAX_ITER: 400000
  LR_STEPS: [280000, 360000]
  GAMMA: 0.1
  BATCH_SIZE: 32
  LR: 1e-3
```
It seems you only trained with coco_2014_valminusminival, which is not included train dataset. What's the total nunber of images you used for training? It should be 118,287, and with the batch size 32, the iteration in one epoch should be 3696.

By the way, the difference of mAP in minival and in test may be not great.
Total 35185 images. The origin paper only used trainval35k, should I add coco_train_2014 dataset?
Yes, `trainval35k` means `train2014` together with about 35k out of `val2014` (exclude 5k for validation), so the number of training set should be 118287.

@d-li14 OK, thank you so much, I used to think `trainval35k` only contains the 35k val images.

I'll update the config file and then the metric.
I think the lack of samples is main reason for  poor evaluation results.
@LightToYang Agree. Later I'll update the new trained metric.
